verses.text: 那麼，論到在血統（「血統」原文作「肉身」）上作我們祖先的亞伯拉罕所經驗的，我們可以說甚麼呢？

words.note: Refers to physical or genetic descent.
Used here after a noun to indicate 'in terms of' or 'on the basis of'.
Indicates that the following verb is the object of the preceding noun, or a passive construction.
Used to nominalize the preceding verb phrase '所經驗' into 'that which was experienced'.

verses.text: 亞伯拉罕若是因行為稱義，就有可誇的，只是不能在 神面前誇口。

words.note: Often contrasted with 'faith' in biblical contexts regarding salvation.
Combines 'can/worthy of' and 'to boast'.
Used to nominalize the adjective '可誇' into 'something worthy of boasting'.
Refers to the singular divine being. Often elevated in print (　神).
Literally 'to boast with the mouth'.

verses.text: 經上怎麼樣說呢？「亞伯拉罕信 神，這就算為他的義。」

words.note: Literally 'on the scripture', meaning 'as it is written in scripture'.

words.definition: to be counted as, to be reckoned as
words.note: A common biblical phrase for imputation.
Moral rightness, justice, or right standing before God.

verses.text: 作工的得工資，不算是恩典，是他應得的。

words.note: Used here to mean 'the one who works'.
Divine favor or mercy, unmerited gift.
Used here to mean 'that which is deserved'.

verses.text: 可是，那不作工而只信那稱不敬虔的人為義的 神的，他的信就算為義了。

words.note: Used here to introduce 'the one who'.
Connects clauses, indicating a contrast or continuation.
Used to modify the following noun phrase '稱不敬虔的人為義的神'.
Describes those lacking reverence for God.
Used to connect the adjective '不敬虔' to '人'.
Used to indicate the result or status: 'to declare X as Y'.
Connects the clause '稱不敬虔的人為義' as a modifier of '神'.
This '的' nominalizes the long preceding clause '那不作工而只信那稱不敬虔的人為義的神' to refer to 'that type of person'.

words.definition: to be counted as, to be reckoned as

words.note: Indicates a change of state or completion of an action.

verses.text: 大衛也是這樣說，那不靠行為而蒙 神算為義的人是有福的！

words.note: Often used for receiving blessing or suffering in formal contexts.
The leading space is often used in Chinese Bibles out of reverence for God.
Literally 'have blessing'.

verses.text: 「過犯得蒙赦免，罪惡得到遮蓋的人，是有福的；

words.note: Indicates successful outcome or a passive construction.
Often used for receiving blessing or suffering in formal contexts.
Indicates successful outcome or a passive construction.
Often used as a verb complement to indicate successful action.
Literally 'have blessing'.

verses.text: 主不算為有罪的，這人是有福的。」

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in a religious context.
Literally 'have sin'.
Literally 'have blessing'.

verses.text: 這樣看來，那有福的人，是指受割禮的呢，還是指沒有受割禮的呢？因為我們說：「亞伯拉罕的信算為他的義。」

words.note: Often used to introduce a conclusion or inference.
Literally 'have blessing'.
Literally 'cutting rite'.
Literally 'cutting rite'.
Can also mean 'to believe' as a verb.

verses.text: 那麼，是怎樣算的呢？是在他受割禮以後呢，還是在他受割禮之前呢？不是在他受割禮以後，而是他受了割禮以前。

words.note: Literally 'cutting rite'.
Literally 'cutting rite'.
Literally 'cutting rite'.
Literally 'cutting rite'.

verses.text: 他領受了割禮為記號，作他受割禮之前因信稱義的印證，使他作所有沒有受割禮而信之人的父，使他們也被算為義；

words.note: A Jewish religious rite of cutting the foreskin.
Refers to being declared righteous by God.

verses.text: 又作受割禮之人的父，就是作那些不僅受割禮，並且照著我們祖宗亞伯拉罕未受割禮時就信的那腳蹤而行之人的父。
原來 神給亞伯拉罕和他後裔承受世界的應許，並不是因著律法，而是藉著因信而來的義。
如果屬於律法的人才能成為後嗣，信就沒有作用，應許也就落空了。
因為律法帶來刑罰，沒有律法，就沒有違背律法的事。
所以，成為後嗣是因著信，為的是要按著 神的恩典，使給所有後裔的應許堅定不移，不但臨到那屬於律法的人，也臨到那效法亞伯拉罕而信的人。亞伯拉罕在 神面前作我們眾人的父，

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

verses.text: 如經上所記：「我已經立了你作萬國的父。」他所信的，是叫死人得生命、使無變為有的 神。
在他沒有盼望的時候，仍然懷著盼望去信，因此就成了萬國的父，正如 神所說：「你的後裔將要這樣眾多。」
他快到一百歲的時候，想到自己的身體好像已經死了，撒拉也不能生育，他的信心還是不軟弱，
也沒有因著不信而疑惑 神的應許，反倒堅信不移，把榮耀歸給 神，
滿心相信 神所應許的， 神必能成就。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.
Introduces a passive or nominalized clause.
Refers to the Christian God.

verses.text: 因此，這就算為他的義。

words.note: Refers to spiritual righteousness or justification.

verses.text: 「算為他的義」這一句話，不是單為他寫的，

words.note: Refers to spiritual righteousness or justification.

verses.text: 也是為我們這將來得算為義的人寫的，就是為我們這信 神使我們的主耶穌從死人中復活的人寫的。

words.definition: to obtain, to be able to
words.note: Indicates possibility or outcome.
Refers to spiritual righteousness or justification.
Refers to the Christian God.
A common compound title for Jesus.
Used as a postposition with '從'.

verses.text: 耶穌為我們的過犯被交去處死，為我們的稱義而復活。

words.definition: and, consequently, for the purpose of
